fn.p: IAS 37 Provisions, Contingent Liabilities and Contingent Assets defines executory contracts as contracts under which neither party has performed any of its obligations or both parties have partially performed their obligations to an equal extent.
In these examples monetary amounts are denominated in ‘currency units (CU)’.
If the reporting entity had concluded that this transaction constituted government assistance it would have needed to consider the disclosure requirements in IAS 20.
In finalising the revised version of IAS 24 in 2009, the Board replaced the term ‘state’ with ‘government’.

The consolidation guidance was removed from IAS 27 and the Standard was renamed Separate Financial Statements by IFRS 10 Consolidated Financial Statements issued in May 2011. The accounting requirements for separate financial statements were not changed.
In May 2011, the Board amended IAS 28 and changed its title to Investments in Associates and Joint Ventures.
IFRS 11 Joint Arrangements, issued in May 2011, replaced IAS 31.
